channel.title: Jelly Donut
channel.description:
Hi guys, its been awhile since I've posted a project thread. I wanted to work on a server release for 2013 in order for there to be something for people to try and play with to come up with ideas or possibly use if they find it worthy of development.
Currently I'm working on my ideas about what modules the server will contain and have some code done but nothing major because I rather not jump headfirst into the project and run into dreaded design issues. I want the project to be innovative, creative, fun, and interesting for those of you observing.
The thread will evolve as the project evolves, obviously.
So currently you can access one of the design documents that contains all my notes about the current design and all my ideas: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1VIuBxk-_AcGOCCsryk6zS3fNAmOVVKh1aWFcpzQk3R8/pub

Uncommitted updates:

  • Added in cache utility classes (CacheIO, FileSystem, UpdateTable, FileTable)
  • Added in a job to trim archives to their proper size.

Currently reworking the ArchiveProvider, and ArchiveManager.

The source will be updated when it is stable.

item.title: Jelly Donut
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Pretty large design update.

  • Service base object will now handle when a connection is requested to be registered.
  • Added base service client object which holds message objects to encode out to the connection for the client.
  • Service state added to assure synchronization between the network thread/service manger thread
  • Updated the Ondemand service to follow the new service model
  • Change some Ondemand constant names to make more sense
  • Repackaged most of the message/message handlers
  • Ondemand service will now write up to the amount of bytes per cycle and not in increments of 512

This update was created in anticipation for login/game services.

Check it out at:

https://github.com/Hadyn/jelly-donut

Read full topic

item.title: Jelly Donut
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Loveandpower:

[quote]It’s now possible to configure the rate at which the ondemand service writes to a client

How is it done exactly? Purpose of doing this? Pros/cons.[/quote]

You may have to throttle the upload rate.

5000 bytes * 20 cycles per second * 2048 clients = 195.3125 megabytes/second up

Also, if you said to only write 50 bytes, it’d still try and write the entire archive in chunks of 512. But sometimes the archive size is less than 512 and it’s really inefficient to write 10 bytes per cycle if the archive isnt large.

            int amountToWrite = bytesPerCycle; //Bytes per cycle = rate
            while(amountToWrite > 0) {
                ArchiveRequest archiveRequest = client.getActiveRequest();
                Connection connection = client.getConnection();
                boolean pollRequest = archiveRequest == null || archiveRequest.isDone(archiveManager);
                if(pollRequest) {
                    archiveRequest = client.pollArchiveRequest();
                    if(archiveRequest == null) {
                        break;
                    }
                    if(!archiveManager.isValid(archiveRequest)) {
                        logger.info("invalid archive request sent from '" + connection.getHostAddress() +"', closing connection [" + archiveRequest + "]");
                        client.resetActiveRequest();
                        continue;
                    }
                }
                int length = archiveManager.getSize(archiveRequest) - archiveRequest.getOffset();
                if(length > ArchiveRequest.CHUNK_SIZE) {
                    length = ArchiveRequest.CHUNK_SIZE;
                }
                if(connection.getRemaining() < length) {
                    break;
                }
                writeArchiveRequestChunk(archiveRequest, client.getConnection()); //Always writes 512 or less
                amountToWrite -= length;
            }

Read full topic

item.title: Jelly Donut
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Ambokile:

[quote author=sinisoul link=topic=637648.msg4311751#msg4311751 date=1370860801]- Maven building crap. How does it work? That’s the goal to find out.

Why? I see so many projects using all kinds of different tools to package the dependencies. It’d just be easier to put them all into a single archive and would make it a lot easier to use.[/quote]

I have a dedicated server I need to run tests on with the source, using ANT/maven would be easier for me.

Loveandpower:

[quote]It’s now possible to configure the rate at which the ondemand service writes to a client, in bytes per cycle. A cycle delay is determined by the server engine pulse rate which currently stands at 50 milliseconds. A total of 97kb will be wrote to the client per second in perfect conditions. Note ‘perfect conditions’.

Care to elaborate some more on this?[/quote]

In what way?

Read full topic

item.title: Jelly Donut
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Doesn’t matter, thread got bumped.

I’m going to try and format the threads in such a way where updates are listed in a more appropriate manner. Its always hard to keep track of what changes, and often times there aren’t anything really significant to note that changed.

Recent Updates

  • It’s now possible to configure the rate at which the ondemand service writes to a client, in bytes per cycle. A cycle delay is determined by the server engine pulse rate which currently stands at 50 milliseconds. A total of 97kb will be wrote to the client per second in perfect conditions. Note ‘perfect conditions’.

  • Fixed some network logic bugs where if the amount of packets parsed were throttled it would not parse anymore without further input from the client.

  • Cleaned up some fields to be more ‘readable’.

  • Started to remove logging because its an eyesore and not really needed as of this moment.

  • For anything that needed state checking on cycling, exported it to a separate method for cleanliness.

  • Began thoughts and design on how logging in will work. Got lazy, played LoL with Newty and never really finished this.

Things I (may or may not) want to Finish

  • I don’t really want to write a cache reading package, but I have to.

  • Logging in and game service design.

  • Maven building crap. How does it work? That’s the goal to find out.

Check out the github, give me some feedback, bump the damn thread, send me money, anything. Please.

https://github.com/Hadyn/jelly-donut

Read full topic

item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

I still to this day hate, and will always hate, making the update server. But it’s working, and I can work on login and game components now. I want to optimize the update server and also work on how errors are handled/reported. Music is even working

Check out the latest commit: https://github.com/Hadyn/jelly-donut

item.title: Jelly Donut
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

Technically, Evelus has always somewhat been an active project. I can imagine that it isn’t very easy to create something when the basis of the server isn’t actually completed yet. We’re still in the process of deciding what exactly we want to do with the game and create blueprints before we begin building from the ground up.

Read full topic

item.title: Jelly Donut
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Still love you man. Sorry for saying that.

@Wintercanon:

I have meant to reply for awhile. Some of the functionality will have to be scripted in Ruby. Is it a bit of a learning gap? Yes. Why did I go that route? Efficiency and the fact there are many things that I cannot do in java that I can do in Ruby. I don’t want for the server to be complex and honestly I don’t think it will be by using ruby over java to develop content but I think it will take a little bit for people to get used to, which if there is a strong support for the source I don’t see that being a problem. Some configuring could be done in java if needed and I will try and see if there are any way for that to be possible.

Update news:

New additions to core/core.msg

https://github.com/Hadyn/jelly-donut/commit/7e438036e39972bf0c555ab040e4953ea1cda230

Edit: There’s a newer commit than that one.

Read full topic
